It belongs to the family Meringiaceae and is known for its delicate, translucent leaves that resemble the shell of a bivalve mollusk. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical rainforests. Its reproductive cycle involves the production of small, spore-like structures that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
